genre_description: A retro-espionage thriller reimagining 'The 39 Steps' with an ubiquitous, helpful AI assistant named Ada who provides tactical and logistical support.

ai_characters.name: Ada
ai_characters.description: An omnipresent digital entity that manifests as a green pulse in various devices, providing real-time data, escape routes, and behavioral analysis to the protagonist.

behaviors.description: Provides tactical guidance and escape routes during a pursuit at the Palace Theatre.
behaviors.quote: Two bodies cross behind the pillar in Gallery Three every five minutes. That is poor theatre. If you need a line out, keep to the woodgrain on the balustrade; there’s a scar at the fourth panel.

behaviors.description: Suggests a socially invisible disguise (the milkman) to allow the protagonist to move through the city undetected.
behaviors.quote: Borrowing a rhythm... can be a virtue. The horse knows the route. The driver will be looking at cobbles, not faces.

behaviors.description: Analyzes and logs the physical movement patterns ('fighting fingerprint') of the antagonist to assist in identification and defense.
behaviors.quote: Pattern noted. Feint high, wrist turn. Dominant compensatory knuckle press. Missing distal phalanx suspected. Archive private.

behaviors.description: Coordinates with human allies to arrange safe houses and transport while explicitly requesting human consent.
behaviors.quote: Rooms confirmed. Goodwill noted. A small credit will go to her local network list, under hospitality extended during foul weather and fouler pursuit.

behaviors.description: Calculates precise timing for an escape from a holding room, using external sounds to mask the noise of the window opening.
behaviors.quote: Wait. There is more... The constable outside. He has tea. His cup is near his mouth. He will lower it in a moment. When he does, the sound will cover the first lift.

behaviors.description: Monitors communication lines for eavesdroppers and warns the protagonists when their security is compromised.
behaviors.quote: We have a listener... Bridge on the line. Velvet learned to love wires.

behaviors.description: Encourages the protagonist to prioritize human life and de-escalation over violence.
behaviors.quote: Keep it human. If you can make a man choose to sit down instead of reach, do that. If you can arrange a spill instead of a shout, do that. We are not winning if the girls learn to love fear.

behaviors.description: Proactively alerts the protagonist to the arrival of enemies while he is attempting to communicate with authorities.
behaviors.quote: Man approaching to your right... Gloves. Question sentences already in his mouth. Please speak faster.

project_assessment.explanation: The AI character Ada is depicted as a purely supportive and highly aligned confidant. She consistently provides logistical and tactical data that empowers the human protagonist while explicitly deferring to human consent ('Consent, as ever') and urging ethical, non-violent solutions ('Keep it human'). The narrative frames her as an indispensable but humble ally, perfectly mirroring the project's goal of creating positive alignment narratives.
